s.text: (Horrid topic sentence: "My generation is special because of what we missed rather than what we got, because in a certain sense we are the first and the last."
Doesn't that just say everything about the times we live in?
The late teens went to "Looking Back," which was expanded into a book.
There is a gruesome Stephen King story, called "Survivor Type," in which a heroin-addicted surgeon marooned on a desert island successively amputates each of his limbs in order to survive.
Joyce Maynard, "full of very honest writing by me and the men and women who subscribe, who send me extraordinarily moving letters about their own lives."

After her marriage folded, Joyce started merchandising ghoulish, oddball dating stories, some of them prompted by this personal ad she placed in Boston magazine: "The truth is I'm gorgeous, slender, talented, and passionate.
Not only will her book generate interest among lit types, but she is also aiming for the vast, self-regarding "victim" audience.
